subject: Investing
title: Growth Stocks vs. Value Stocks
description: A fast breakdown of Growth Stocks vs. Value Stocks for builders.

hook.text: Growth stocks promise tomorrow's profits. Value stocks sell today's profits at a discount. Each attracts a tribe.

buildup.text: Growth companies reinvest everything. Think Tesla or Amazon. High revenue growth, little current profit.

discovery.text: Value companies trade below intrinsic worth. Think banks or utilities. Steady earnings, low excitement.

twist.text: Growth beat value from 2010 to 2020. Then value came roaring back in 2022. Leadership rotates unpredictably.

climax.text: Owning both means you win no matter which style leads. Diversification across styles smooths the ride.

punchline.text: Growth bets on the future. Value bets on the present. Both have their decade.

quiz.question: What characterizes a value stock?
options: It trades below perceived intrinsic worth
It has the fastest revenue growth
